title: Big and Bubbly Focaccia

nutrition.metric: Per serving: 460 kJ (110 calories), 18g carbohydrates, 3g protein, 3g fat, 460mg sodium
nutrition.imperial: Per serving: 110 calories, 18g carbohydrates, 3g protein, 3g fat, 460mg sodium

notes: Recipe uses US measurements as base since from kingarthurbaking.com. Temperature converted using conversion chart: 475°F = 246°C. Weights were already provided in grams alongside cups in original recipe.

imperial.original: 3 cups (360g) King Arthur Unbleached All-Purpose Flour
imperial.name: King Arthur Unbleached All-Purpose Flour

metric: Whisk 360g flour, 9g salt, 5g sugar, and 3g yeast in a large bowl.
Add 284g warm water (32°C to 43°C) and 18g olive oil.
Stir until thoroughly combined with no dry patches.
Use a wet hand to grab dough sections, lift and press into center, circling the bowl 8-12 times.
Flip dough smooth side up after each fold.
Rest 15 minutes, then repeat folding process 3 more times with 15-minute rests between each fold.
Let dough rise at 21-24°C for 1 hour until nearly doubled and puffy.
Spray 23cm square pan with nonstick spray and add parchment paper with olive oil.
Transfer dough to pan, flip to coat in oil.
Let dough rise 1-1.5 hours until marshmallowy and jiggly, filling pan corners.
Drizzle remaining 26g olive oil over surface.
Optional: Broil 1-2 minutes for additional color.
Return to oven for 5-7 minutes to crisp the sides and bottom.
imperial: Whisk 3 cups flour, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, 1 teaspoon sugar, and 1 teaspoon yeast in a large bowl.
Add 1 1/4 cups warm water (90°F to 110°F) and 1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil.
Stir until thoroughly combined with no dry patches.
Use a wet hand to grab dough sections, lift and press into center, circling the bowl 8-12 times.
Flip dough smooth side up after each fold.
Rest 15 minutes, then repeat folding process 3 more times with 15-minute rests between each fold.
Let dough rise at 70-75°F for 1 hour until nearly doubled and puffy.
Spray 9 inch square pan with nonstick spray and add parchment paper with olive oil.
Transfer dough to pan, flip to coat in oil.
Let dough rise 1-1.5 hours until marshmallowy and jiggly, filling pan corners.
Drizzle remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil over surface.
Optional: Broil 1-2 minutes for additional color.
Return to oven for 5-7 minutes to crisp the sides and bottom.
